SEARCH
Package gw.api.json.mapping

Interface TransformResult

public interface TransformResult
The TransformResult class represents the results of performing a transform using a given mapping Mapper. The result has TransformResultValues for each property in the mapping, which can themselves be scalars, lists of scalars, nested TransformResults, or lists of nested TransformResults.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    forEachProperty(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
    This method will invoke the visitor for each value regardless of whether or not the property has errors, so it's the caller's responsibility to check isErrant() as needed.
    void
    forEachPropertyInTree(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
    Similar to forEachProperty, but this method will do an in-order traversal of this result as well as any other TransformResults nested inside TransformResultValues, traversing the entire tree of results.
    void
    forEachPropertyWithoutErrors(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
    This method will invoke the visitor for each value where isErrant() returns false, i.e. where the transform for that property succeeded.
    boolean
    hasErrors()
    Returns true if any of the values on this result, or any of their values and so on down the tree, have any errors
    void
    logErrors()
    Logs all transform errors on values on this result or any nested values
    void
    throwIfErrors()
    Throws an exception if there are errors on any of the transformed values, or any nested values, i.e. if hasErrors() returns true.
    String
    toJsonString()
    Transforms this result into a compact JSON string, using the default serialization options
    String
    toJsonString(JsonSerializationOptions jsonSerializationOptions)
    Transforms this result into a compact JSON string, using the specified JsonSerializationOptions

    Transforms this result into a pretty-printed JSON string, using the default serialization options

      Returns:
      the serialized JSON string

      Transforms this result into a pretty-printed JSON string, using the specified JsonSerializationOptions

      Returns:

    • toXmlElement

      gw.xml.XmlElement toXmlElement()
      Transforms this result into an XmlElement, using the default serialization options
      Returns:
      the XmlElement containing the data from this TransformResult

    • toXmlElement

      gw.xml.XmlElement toXmlElement(JsonSerializationOptions jsonSerializationOptions)
      Transforms this result into an XmlElement, using the specified JsonSerializationOptions
      Parameters:
      jsonSerializationOptions - the JsonSerializationOptions to use
      Returns:
      the XmlElement containing the data from this TransformResult

    • toXmlString

      String toXmlString()
      Transforms this result into an XmlElement, using the default serialization options.

      This is equivalent to calling toXmlElement().asUTFString()

      Returns:
      the serialized XML string

    • toXmlString

      String toXmlString(JsonSerializationOptions jsonSerializationOptions)
      Transforms this result into an XmlElement, using the specified JsonSerializationOptions

      This is equivalent to calling toXmlElement(jsonSerializationOptions).asUTFString()

      Parameters:
      jsonSerializationOptions - the JsonSerializationOptions to use
      Returns:
      the serialized XML string

    • forEachPropertyWithoutErrors

      void forEachPropertyWithoutErrors(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
      This method will invoke the visitor for each value where isErrant() returns false, i.e. where the transform for that property succeeded. This is the method you likely want to use when serializing a result. Properties will be visited in alphabetical order.

    • forEachProperty

      void forEachProperty(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
      This method will invoke the visitor for each value regardless of whether or not the property has errors, so it's the caller's responsibility to check isErrant() as needed. Properties will be visited in alphabetical order.

    • forEachPropertyInTree

      void forEachPropertyInTree(BiConsumer<? super String,? super TransformResultValue> visitor)
      Similar to forEachProperty, but this method will do an in-order traversal of this result as well as any other TransformResults nested inside TransformResultValues, traversing the entire tree of results.

    • hasErrors

      boolean hasErrors()
      Returns true if any of the values on this result, or any of their values and so on down the tree, have any errors

    • logErrors

      void logErrors()
      Logs all transform errors on values on this result or any nested values

    • throwIfErrors

      void throwIfErrors()
      Throws an exception if there are errors on any of the transformed values, or any nested values, i.e. if hasErrors() returns true.
